channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2023080079
item.description:
Report E-2023080079

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-23T18:12:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: KENNESAW
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14, 2023, two (2) 50-gallon drums of cinnamyl nitril (UN3278) were leaking from the bungs and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the impacted site. ER personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release. The crew them utilized hand tools to containerize all UN3278-impacted material in one (1) 5-gallon bucket.

item.title: Report E-2023070963
item.description:
Report E-2023070963

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: STONE MOUNTAIN
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: METRO PETRO LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The truck and trailer were traveling East in US 78 in Stone Mountain GA. The driver then took the W Park Pl Blvd exit and proceeded to turn right onto W Park Pl Blvd. There is a traffic light at the intersection and the driver had the green light. As the driver was completing the turn, he felt the trailer shift and when he checked in his mirrors, he observed the trailer rolling over. The truck did not attempt to roll over and he was able to pull the truck over to the side of the road and stop. The trailer rolled onto the lift side then top and the right side landed on top of a car waiting at the traffic signal which was red. There was another car in front of the car it landed on and it struck the rear of the car which was later driven from the scene buy the occupants. The seam split on the lower left of the tank which did not leak because of the final resting position of the tank, it was at the top above the level of the fuel. The crack was a direct result of the rollover. The crack was later enlarged to facilitate the removal of the fuel from that compartment. The rear most top inspection hatch was leaking and the fire department added an additional clamp to the lid to slow the leak and they put a containment pool under the lid to catch the leaking fuel. The bulkheads between compartments 4, and 5 the comp internally ruptured into the void. Holes were then drilled into the side of the trailer which were facing up and the majority of the fuel was pumped from the trailer while it was on it's side. The trailer was the righted and the remaining fuel was pumped from the load heads on the bottom of trailer. The fire department made a small earthen dam to stop the flow of fuel from the small leaks while we were waiting for the Hazmat cleanup companies to arrive. They then use absorbent material and booms to catch and contain the small leaks.

item.title: Report E-2023070961
item.description:
Report E-2023070961

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: BRUNSWICK
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stated he is hands off at this location, Symrise is responsible for the loading. Driver stated that the trailer was overfilled because site operator left loading area. Driver had to call Symrise to alert them the trailer was overflowing. Symrise operator shut down. Driver estimates about 500 gallons was spilled into containment area.

item.title: Report X-2023060854
item.description:
Report X-2023060854

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-19T00:29:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package, was brought to the attention of the dg specialist at our station located in Alanta, GA when it was seen the package was wet on the bottom indicating a spill inside. Part of a multi piece shipment, the package was a fibreboard box packed with ID 8000 Consumer Commodities. Sliced brown paper was used for dunnage. Inspection of package found that bottle of Super Goop!! Glow Oil SPF50 was found to have leaked the entirety of its contents. it is reported to have leaked from the cap, though cause of leak is unknown. Package was instructed to be placed in a steel salvage drum and contact shipper for amended shipper's declaration.
